description.raw:
Several things:

1. We just made a prerelease of `libsdformat3` for use with the default branch of gazebo. Since we are using `find_package(SDFormat 2)` and sdformat's cmake config file is using `SameMajorVersion`, it won't accept sdformat3. So I add `find_package(SDFormat 3)` if the first one fails.

2. sdformat behavior was changed in 2.3.1 to [ignore unknown elements](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-request/148/ignore-unknown-elements/diff). This causes a `UNIT_msgs_TEST` failure, which I fix here. I also bumped the minimum sdformat2 version to 2.3.1 to ensure that the test will pass.

3. Make `INTEGRATION_factory` a DRI test, since it uses a pr2 with a camera. It has been [failing in the non-GPU jenkins jobs](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-default-devel-trusty-amd64/1250/testReport/junit/(root)/INTEGRATION_factory/test_ran/).

4. Fix SDF shasums in `UNIT_gz_TEST`. It's annoying to fix these all the time (#1332), and it occurred to me that we could move the `gz sdf` tool functionality to a separate command-line tool in the sdformat repository ([sdformat issue 85](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/issue/85/gz-sdf-command-line-tool-should-be-in)), which would make it easier to keep the test in sync with the sdformat description.

I'll update with Jenkins results as available.
description.html:
Several things:

  1. We just made a prerelease of libsdformat3 for use with the default branch of gazebo. Since we are using find_package(SDFormat 2) and sdformat's cmake config file is using SameMajorVersion, it won't accept sdformat3. So I add find_package(SDFormat 3) if the first one fails.

  2. sdformat behavior was changed in 2.3.1 to ignore unknown elements. This causes a UNIT_msgs_TEST failure, which I fix here. I also bumped the minimum sdformat2 version to 2.3.1 to ensure that the test will pass.

  3. Make INTEGRATION_factory a DRI test, since it uses a pr2 with a camera. It has been failing in the non-GPU jenkins jobs.

  4. Fix SDF shasums in UNIT_gz_TEST. It's annoying to fix these all the time (#1332), and it occurred to me that we could move the gz sdf tool functionality to a separate command-line tool in the sdformat repository (sdformat issue 85), which would make it easier to keep the test in sync with the sdformat description.

I'll update with Jenkins results as available.

title.raw: gazebo5: allow sdformat3 and fix tests

Several things:

  1. We just made a prerelease of libsdformat3 for use with the default branch of gazebo. Since we are using find_package(SDFormat 2) and sdformat's cmake config file is using SameMajorVersion, it won't accept sdformat3. So I add find_package(SDFormat 3) if the first one fails.

  2. sdformat behavior was changed in 2.3.1 to ignore unknown elements. This causes a UNIT_msgs_TEST failure, which I fix here. I also bumped the minimum sdformat2 version to 2.3.1 to ensure that the test will pass.

  3. Make INTEGRATION_factory a DRI test, since it uses a pr2 with a camera. It has been failing in the non-GPU jenkins jobs.

  4. Fix SDF shasums in UNIT_gz_TEST. It's annoying to fix these all the time (#1332), and it occurred to me that we could move the gz sdf tool functionality to a separate command-line tool in the sdformat repository (sdformat issue 85), which would make it easier to keep the test in sync with the sdformat description.

I'll update with Jenkins results as available.
